KH.content: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”
KH.linkedContent: “Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”

GOD.content: father accuses literary writing of parasitism, the son should have worked instead of written [pharmakon, meteor]
GOD.linkedContent: father accuses literary writing of parasitism, the son should have worked instead of written [pharmakon, meteor]

MPM.content: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]
MPM.linkedContent: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]

MPM.content: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”

MC.content: [Nietzsche’s etymologizing in On Genealogy] méchance (mean, bad, low): bad luck; malchance: Austin’s “infelicity,” parasite (breach of contract) [the clinic, those who fell (ill)]
MC.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s etymologizing in On Genealogy] méchance (mean, bad, low): bad luck; malchance: Austin’s “infelicity,” parasite (breach of contract) [the clinic, those who fell (ill)]

H.content: guest or parasite? a guest who is wrong, illegitimate
H.linkedContent: guest or parasite? a guest who is wrong, illegitimate

A.content: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility
A.linkedContent: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility

SEC.content: writing has always been treated as a parasite
SEC.linkedContent: writing has always been treated as a parasite

SEC.content: insufficiency of speech act theory > parasitism and citationality not considered ordinary: “non-serious,” “non-ordinary,” sea change, etiolation
SEC.linkedContent: insufficiency of speech act theory > parasitism and citationality not considered ordinary: “non-serious,” “non-ordinary,” sea change, etiolation

SEC.content: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?
SEC.linkedContent: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?

PP.content: how can supplementary parasite be excluded by maintaining boundary or triangle?
PP.linkedContent: how can supplementary parasite be excluded by maintaining boundary or triangle?

PP.content: pharmakon, letter installing itself inside living organism (logos-zōōn), robbing it of nourishment; “logic” tries to keep the parasite outside, the outside out
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon, letter installing itself inside living organism (logos-zōōn), robbing it of nourishment; “logic” tries to keep the parasite outside, the outside out

PAS.content: the other pas haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor
PAS.linkedContent: the other pas haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor

F.content: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve
F.linkedContent: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve

ROP.content: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return
ROP.linkedContent: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return

ROP.content: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)
ROP.linkedContent: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)

ROP.content: all identities (madness, reason, history) in history of madness would be divided from w/in, threatened in advance by parasitism, like a computer virus (though w/out any antivirus)
ROP.linkedContent: all identities (madness, reason, history) in history of madness would be divided from w/in, threatened in advance by parasitism, like a computer virus (though w/out any antivirus)

PS.content: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body, the body has no need of organs; Heart: “dirtiest means that any being could have invented to pump life inside me” > Artaud as fearful of articulated body as articulated language
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body, the body has no need of organs; Heart: “dirtiest means that any being could have invented to pump life inside me” > Artaud as fearful of articulated body as articulated language

PIO.content: specularization paralyzes “Fable” (seems to freeze text)—undecidability of whether fabulous discourse makes it out of itself or is the very misfortune (malheurs) of the [possibility of the] mirror, infelicity of constative/performative (way they parasite each other)
PIO.linkedContent: specularization paralyzes “Fable” (seems to freeze text)—undecidability of whether fabulous discourse makes it out of itself or is the very misfortune (malheurs) of the [possibility of the] mirror, infelicity of constative/performative (way they parasite each other)

TR.content: for Austin, a machine could never achieve a performative, intervenes in performative event as a parasite, as extrinsic, accidental
TR.linkedContent: for Austin, a machine could never achieve a performative, intervenes in performative event as a parasite, as extrinsic, accidental

PPT.content: essential parasitizing opens every system to its outside, divides unity of the line (trait) purported to mark the system’s edges
PPT.linkedContent: essential parasitizing opens every system to its outside, divides unity of the line (trait) purported to mark the system’s edges

PPT.content: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints
PPT.linkedContent: trait acts as a passe-partout: multiplies dealings and transactions (contraband, graft and parasitizing among them); still, passe-partout must formally answer to finite system of constraints

LI.content: Derrida’s going to be as serious, as normal, as he can, and reduce parasitism: “you can take my word for it”
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s going to be as serious, as normal, as he can, and reduce parasitism: “you can take my word for it”

LI.content: Derrida intentionally including in his debate w/ Sarl the contingent, artificial, external (18 letters, blows)—even the amount of ink in typewriter ribbon: why not? (fringes, frames, parasites)
LI.linkedContent: Derrida intentionally including in his debate w/ Sarl the contingent, artificial, external (18 letters, blows)—even the amount of ink in typewriter ribbon: why not? (fringes, frames, parasites)

LI.content: surface of the paper, part of our calculation?
LI.linkedContent: surface of the paper, part of our calculation?

LI.content: unconscious as giant/great Parasite > not as lateral, virtual potential of consciousness
LI.linkedContent: unconscious as giant/great Parasite > not as lateral, virtual potential of consciousness

LI.content: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?
LI.linkedContent: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?

LI.content: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]
LI.linkedContent: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]

LI.content: Sarl incorporates the parasite—retains the object w/in itself as something excluded > psychoanalytic incorporation delegitimizes Sarl’s claim of foreign body, impossible to assimilate, must be rejected
LI.linkedContent: Sarl incorporates the parasite—retains the object w/in itself as something excluded > psychoanalytic incorporation delegitimizes Sarl’s claim of foreign body, impossible to assimilate, must be rejected

LI.content: la hantise of the graft, herein no different from the parasite > never simply alien to and separable from the body it already haunts
LI.linkedContent: la hantise of the graft, herein no different from the parasite > never simply alien to and separable from the body it already haunts

LI.content: did Derrida make seriousness of philosophical discourse skid towards literary play [parasitizing Descartes’ title in SEC]? unless seriousness were already the para-site of such play
LI.linkedContent: did Derrida make seriousness of philosophical discourse skid towards literary play [parasitizing Descartes’ title in SEC]? unless seriousness were already the para-site of such play

LI.content: parasitism does not need theater or literature to appear
LI.linkedContent: parasitism does not need theater or literature to appear

LI.content: a promise that can’t be reiterated would not be a promise > thus the possibility of a parasite
LI.linkedContent: a promise that can’t be reiterated would not be a promise > thus the possibility of a parasite

LI.content: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event
LI.linkedContent: parasite can never be excluded from body “proper” > “an owner” calls it parasite (jealously defending his oikos) > whatever violently “takes place” always something of a parasite, offered hospitality, a place, by host: never quite taking place is part of parasite’s success as an event

LI.content: in speech act theory, the parasite is secondary, it is “logically dependent” on a nonparasitical onto-logical order; this logic enables its exclusion
LI.linkedContent: in speech act theory, the parasite is secondary, it is “logically dependent” on a nonparasitical onto-logical order; this logic enables its exclusion

LI.content: logic of parasitism not one of distinction or opposition, neither same as nor different from what it parasites: possibility of fiction cannot be derived
LI.linkedContent: logic of parasitism not one of distinction or opposition, neither same as nor different from what it parasites: possibility of fiction cannot be derived

LI.content: pharmakoi, people on welfare, spies, effects of unconscious
LI.linkedContent: pharmakoi, people on welfare, spies, effects of unconscious

LI.content: not conflating parasitism & citationality but identifying possibility they have in common [i.e. iterability] (use of or that signifies neither equivalence, dissociation, nor opposition)
LI.linkedContent: not conflating parasitism & citationality but identifying possibility they have in common [i.e. iterability] (use of or that signifies neither equivalence, dissociation, nor opposition)

LI.content: parasitism susceptible to parasitism of citation; citation can always be parasited by parasite
LI.linkedContent: parasitism susceptible to parasitism of citation; citation can always be parasited by parasite

LI.content: parasite parasites the limits that guarantee purity of rules/intentions: this has import for law, politics, ethics, economics
LI.linkedContent: parasite parasites the limits that guarantee purity of rules/intentions: this has import for law, politics, ethics, economics

LI.content: another parasitic/fictional structure can always be added, “supplément de code” > everything becomes possible against the language-police
LI.linkedContent: another parasitic/fictional structure can always be added, “supplément de code” > everything becomes possible against the language-police

LI.content: never be able to de-limit object-fiction/object-parasite except by another counter-fiction
LI.linkedContent: never be able to de-limit object-fiction/object-parasite except by another counter-fiction

LI.content: translation: case of parasitic feedback
LI.linkedContent: translation: case of parasitic feedback

LI.content: parasitic structure: writing, graft, mark, marche, margin, differance, undecidable, supplement, pharmakon, hymen, parergon
LI.linkedContent: parasitic structure: writing, graft, mark, marche, margin, differance, undecidable, supplement, pharmakon, hymen, parergon

LI.content: as though an auxiliary/parasite could not supplant, as if “parasite” is a simple addition
LI.linkedContent: as though an auxiliary/parasite could not supplant, as if “parasite” is a simple addition

LI.content: inner purity & exterior supplement—this is myth itself (mythology of a logos)
LI.linkedContent: inner purity & exterior supplement—this is myth itself (mythology of a logos)

LI.content: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?
LI.linkedContent: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?

LI.content: theoretical duty is thus always “ethical-political duty” > highly political nature of status of parasite: politics of immigration > what’s “foreign” touches all social institutions—everything
LI.linkedContent: theoretical duty is thus always “ethical-political duty” > highly political nature of status of parasite: politics of immigration > what’s “foreign” touches all social institutions—everything

TN.content: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)
TN.linkedContent: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)

LG.content: law of law of genre: principle of contamination, parasitical economy, participation w/out belonging
LG.linkedContent: law of law of genre: principle of contamination, parasitical economy, participation w/out belonging

OG.content: what is “after”? is the “after” always parasitic? what is a parasite? do we really learn to write and read “after” we learn to speak?
OG.linkedContent: what is “after”? is the “after” always parasitic? what is a parasite? do we really learn to write and read “after” we learn to speak?

ATAP.content: perversion of voice of reason: mix voice of reason w/ voice of oracle (2 voices of other in us), a hermetic, hermeneutic seduction > oracular parasitizes voice of reason, elevates the voice, raises the tone > for Kant, this is Verstimmen (to be deranged, delirious), désaccordement of cords/voices [tone] in head: vision w/out concept turned impatiently toward most “crypted” secret > poetico-metaphorical overabundance
ATAP.linkedContent: perversion of voice of reason: mix voice of reason w/ voice of oracle (2 voices of other in us), a hermetic, hermeneutic seduction > oracular parasitizes voice of reason, elevates the voice, raises the tone > for Kant, this is Verstimmen (to be deranged, delirious), désaccordement of cords/voices [tone] in head: vision w/out concept turned impatiently toward most “crypted” secret > poetico-metaphorical overabundance

CIR.content: nervous, worried, hunted, literature (beast playing dead, melding w/ foliage), delivering to world impregnable inedible simulacrum, the theory of the parasite virus, terrorizing others w/ instability he carries everywhere, one book open in the other
CIR.linkedContent: nervous, worried, hunted, literature (beast playing dead, melding w/ foliage), delivering to world impregnable inedible simulacrum, the theory of the parasite virus, terrorizing others w/ instability he carries everywhere, one book open in the other

EU.content: university as a child of metaphysics & tehnē > once this offspring exceeds places assigned to it, becomes invasive margin: university “idea” reigns everywhere
EU.linkedContent: university as a child of metaphysics & tehnē > once this offspring exceeds places assigned to it, becomes invasive margin: university “idea” reigns everywhere

EU.content: parasite everywhere there’s language, public, publishing > to wish to control/exclude parasites is a misunderstanding of speech acts
EU.linkedContent: parasite everywhere there’s language, public, publishing > to wish to control/exclude parasites is a misunderstanding of speech acts

EU.content: [re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie
EU.linkedContent: [re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie

SPEC.content: Derrida explains that a certain passage [on Freud’s indifference to whether Ernst invented game or not] is okay to extract, appears dissociable, a parasite from its immediate context, resonates like sound from elsewhere—murmur
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida explains that a certain passage [on Freud’s indifference to whether Ernst invented game or not] is okay to extract, appears dissociable, a parasite from its immediate context, resonates like sound from elsewhere—murmur
